newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Sulzer breaks down outlook by division.
newsitem.headline: Sulzer breaks down outlook by division.

text.p: Sulzer AG said on Wednesday it expected a 1996 operating loss from its Sulzer Rueti weaving machinery division although Sulzer as a whole expects higher net and operating income this year.
"Sulzer Rueti is still combating adverse market conditions and the losses are expected to be higher than last year," Sulzer chief executive Fritz Fahrni said at a news conference.
He said reorganisation measures and personnel reductions were still under way at the division and would be intensified. But the measures were not expected to bear fruit until 1997.
Fahrni also said setbacks had occurred in the Sulzer Winterthur locomotive and turbine division and as a result the group's operating income was expected to decline slightly.
Operating income increases were expected at the Sulzermedica medical products division and the Sulzer Infra plant and building services division would contribute to reducing losses, Fahrni also said.
